newsitem.title: POLAND: Warsaw commodities exchange sacks president.
newsitem.headline: Warsaw commodities exchange sacks president.

text.p: The Warsaw Commodities Exchange (WGT) sacked on Wednesday its president, Eugeniusz Sobczak, and appointed the WGT's hitherto deputy head, Jan Traczyk, to replace him, PAP news agency said.
It quoted Traczyk as saying he would strive to quickly introduce derivative instruments to the exchange, which now trades mainly in grain, meat and their products on a cash basis three times a week.
First transactions in commodity futures and options should take place in January or, at the latest, February 1997, Traczyk said.
He noted however, that for the derivatives market to operate, the exchange needed a clearing house and a system of licensed warehouses.
The WGT cooperates closely with the Chicago Board of Trade.
